predicate.note: Frames file for 'ring' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: to (cause) to make a sound of a bell

example.name: passive
example.text: According to a nationwide survey taken [*] a year ago , nearly a third of England 's church bells are no longer rung [*-1] on Sundays because there is no one [0] [*T*-2] to ring them .
example.arg: [*-1] -> nearly a third of England 's church bells
because there is no one [0] [*T*-2] to ring them

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: `` [*-1] To ring for even one service at this tower , we have [*-1] to scrape , '' says [*T*-2] Mr. Hammond , a retired water-authority worker .

example.name: intransitive with Arg0
example.text: One survey says that of the 100,000 trained bellringers in England today , only 40,000 of them still ring .

example.name: intransitive with Arg1
example.text: There were too many phones ringing and too many things happening [*] to expect market makers to be as efficient as robots .

example.name: both arguments
example.text: Meanwhile , in the squat office buildings that [*T*-1] ring Fashion Island , the odds [*ICH*-3] are good that someone is getting fleeced [*-2] .

example.name: transitive
example.text: Younkers rang up sales [*ICH*-1] in 1988 of $ 313 million [*U*] .
